title: Tammy Abraham set goals target as Hasselbaink makes exciting Chelsea prediction
text:
Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink has set Chelsea striker Tammy Abraham a goals target (Picture: Getty)

Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink has challenged Tammy Abraham to score at least 20 goals for Chelsea this season and backed Frank Lampard’s young guns to ‘dominate’ the Premier League.

Abraham, 22, made his senior debut for the Blues three years ago but is only now enjoying a prolonged run in the first-team under new manager and club legend Lampard.

The England international has scored eight goals in ten appearances this term and helped Lampard secure his first Champions League win as a manager at Lille on Wednesday.

Asked for his thoughts on Abraham, former striker Hasselbaink told Sky Sports: ‘Very good, very sharp around the box – I like him. His movement is really good.

Hasselbaink says Chelsea’s young guns can ‘dominate’ the Premier League (Picture: Getty)

‘I think when he plays in a dominant team he will score lots of goals because of his movement and he gets himself on the end of things. That is a good habit to have.

‘He holds the ball up [well], gets the ball past [the defender] and gets his shots away. Those are really good attributes that a striker needs to have.

‘He scores ugly goals. So for me he should be able to get 20 plus goals.’

Abraham was one of four Chelsea players included in Gareth Southgate’s England squad this week.

The Blues are currently seventh in the Premier League but Hasselbaink has been impressed by Lampard’s young side and says they can ‘dominate’ the Premier League in ‘two or three years’.

‘It’s magnificent to see,’ he said, referring to Chelsea’s youth being handed international call-ups.

‘For Chelsea, especially, their identity has not been like that in the past but if they can keep this group together and they have got Callum [Hudson-Odoi] as well, Ruben [Loftus-Cheek], Reece James.

‘If they can keep those boys together I think in two or three years Chelsea can really dominate the Premier League, obviously with additions to the squad.

‘It is nice to see, also for the Chelsea fans. I do think that the Chelsea fans should be patient because if you want to see young players you are not going to win trophies or compete for the Premier League [straight away].

‘If Chelsea can still keep themselves in Europe, hopefully in the Champions League, with these players and let them get the experience then the future is going to be very bright for Chelsea.’

Lampard’s Chelsea travel to St Mary’s on Sunday to face Southampton, who are currently 14th in the Premier League.
